owl:Ontology.terms:creator: http://oxgiraldo.wordpress.com/
owl:Ontology.terms:description: Here is presented an example showing information that is being modeled in SP-Workflow. The individuals and their corresponding descriptions were extracted from a protocol about extraction of total RNA (the protocols is available here: http://www.biotechniques.com/protocols/Peer-Reviewed_Protocols/Extraction-of-total-RNA-from-freshfrozen-tissue-FT/biotechniques-181792.html)
owl:Ontology.terms:title: SP-Workflow Module: Use case
owl:Ontology.rdfs:label: SP-Workflow Module: Use case

owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: A phrase describing how a class name should be used. May also include other kinds of examples that facilitate immediate understanding of a class semantics, such as widely known prototypical subclasses or instances of the class. Although essential for high level terms, examples for low level terms (e.g., Affymetrix HU133 array) are not
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: example of usage

owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: The official definition, explaining the meaning of a class or property. Shall be Aristotelian, formalized and normalized. Can be augmented with colloquial definitions.
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: definition

owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: An alternative name for a class or property which means the same thing as the preferred name (semantically equivalent)
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: alternative term

owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: formal citation, e.g. identifier in external database to indicate / attribute source(s) for the definition. Free text indicate / attribute source(s) for the definition. EXAMPLE: Author Name, URI, MeSH Term C04, PUBMED ID, Wiki uri on 31.01.2007
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: definition source

owl:AnnotationProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: For external terms/classes, the ontology from which the term was imported
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: imported from

owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: x precedes y if and only if the time point at which x ends is before or equivalent to the time point at which y starts. Formally: x precedes y iff ω(x) <= α(y), where α is a function that maps a process to a start point, and ω is a function that maps a process to an end point.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: precedes

owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: participates in is a relation that binds a material entity and a protocol instruction.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: participates in

owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000112: this cell derives from this parent cell (cell division); this nucleus derives from this parent nucleus (nuclear division)
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: a relation between two distinct material entities, the new entity and the old entity, in which the new entity begins to exist when the old entity ceases to exist, and the new entity inherits the significant portion of the matter of the old entity
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: derives from

owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: hasProtocol is a relation that binds a laboratory procedure to a experimental protocol.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has protocol

owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: hasStep is a relation that binds a experimental protocol to a protocol instruction.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has step

owl:ObjectProperty.obo:IAO_0000115: Parthood as a relation between instances: The primitive instance-level relation p part_of p1 is illustrated in assertions such as: this instance of rhodopsin mediated phototransduction part_of this instance of visual perception. This relation satisfies at least the following standard axioms of mereology: reflexivity (for all p, p part_of p); anti-symmetry (for all p, p1, if p part_of p1 and p1 part_of p then p and p1 are identical); and transitivity (for all p, p1, p2, if p part_of p1 and p1 part_of p2, then p part_of p2). Analogous axioms hold also for parthood as a relation between spatial regions. For parthood as a relation between continuants, these axioms need to be modified to take account of the incorporation of a temporal argument. Thus for example the axiom of transitivity for continuants will assert that if c part_of c1 at t and c1 part_of c2 at t, then also c part_of c2 at t. Parthood as a relation between classes: To define part_of as a relation between classes we again need to distinguish the two cases of continuants and processes, even though the explicit reference to instants of time now falls away. For continuants, we have C part_of C1 if and only if any instance of C at any time is an instance-level part of some instance of C1 at that time, as for example in: cell nucleus part_ of cell.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: part of

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: tissue

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: Test LBTEST Laboratory Test Tests Lab Test Lab Tests
owl:Class.rdfs:label: laboratory procedure

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A message describing how something is to be done.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Instruction
instruction

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A homogeneous mixture of two or more substances; frequently (but not necessarily) a liquid solution.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: solution

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: tissue and cells derived from animals for use in research.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: animal tissue

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Expendable and nonexpendable equipment, supplies, apparatus, and instruments that are used in diagnostic, surgical, therapeutic, scientific, and experimental procedures.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: Device Apparatus and Instruments Device, Medical Devices, Medical Instruments and Apparatus Inventory Medical Device Supplies and Equipment MED DEVICE EQUIPMENT SUPPLIES MED DEVICES APPARATUS INSTRUM DEVICES MED DEVICE MED Devices Equipment Inventories Medical Devices Supplies
owl:Class.rdfs:label: equipment and supplies

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A secondary alcohol that is propane in which one of the hydrogens attached to the central carbon is substituted by a hydroxy group.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: i-propanol C3H8O Isopropanol 1-methylethyl alcohol IPA sec-propanol i-Propylalkohol Isopropyl alcohol 2-Propanol isopropyl alcohol CC(C)O Isopropylalkohol 2-hydroxypropane ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL 1-methylethanol
owl:Class.rdfs:label: propan-2-ol

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A compound in which a hydroxy group, -OH, is attached to a saturated carbon atom.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: alcohol

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A substance used in a chemical reaction to detect, measure, examine, or produce other substances.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: reagent

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A one-carbon compound that is methane in which three of the hydrogens are replaced by chlorines.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: trichloromethane CHCl3 Trichlormethan chloroforme [H]C(Cl)(Cl)Cl 1,1,1-trichloromethane chloroformium pro narcosi
owl:Class.rdfs:label: chloroform

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A secondary alcohol is a compound in which a hydroxy group, -OH, is attached to a saturated carbon atom which has two other carbon atoms attached to it.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: secondary alcohols CH2OR2 a secondary alcohol
owl:Class.rdfs:label: secondary alcohol

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: An organic molecular entity containing a single carbon atom (C1).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: one-carbon compound

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000112: Examples of information content entites include journal articles, data, graphical layouts, and graphs.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: an information content entity is an entity that is generically dependent on some artifact and stands in relation of aboutness to some entity
owl:Class.rdfs:label: information content entity

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000112: Words, sentences, paragraphs, and the written (non-figure) parts of publications are all textual entities
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A textual entity is a part of a manifestation (FRBR sense), a generically dependent continuant whose concretizations are patterns of glyphs intended to be interpreted as words, formulas, etc.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: textual entity

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A collection of information content entities intended to be understood together as a whole.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: document

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: a material obtained from an organism in order to be a representative of the whole
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sample from organism

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000112: blood drawn from patient to measure his systemic glucose level. A population of humans with HIV enrolled in a study taken to represent patients with HIV in general.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A material entity that has the material sample role
owl:Class.rdfs:label: material sample

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A plant structure (PO:0009011) that consists predominantly of similarly specialized plant cells (PO:0009002) of one or more types.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: portion of plant tissue portion of tissue
owl:Class.rdfs:label: plant tissue

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A multi-tissue plant structure (PO:0025496) that develops from a plant ovule (PO:0020003) and has as parts a plant embryo (PO:0009009) enclosed in a seed coat (PO:0009088).
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A seed generally develops from an ovule (PO:0020003) after fertilization, but may develop without fertilization in the case of apogamy (e.g., adventitious embryos or somatic embryos). A seed is a reproductive unit of seed plants (gymnosperms, angiosperms, and fossil pteridosperms).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: seed

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A determinate reproductive shoot system that has as part at least one carpel or at least one stamen and does not contain any other determinate shoot system as a part.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: diclinous flower pistillate flower staminate flower basal flower double flower female flower hermaphrodite flower male flower perfect flower imperfect flower monoclinous flower flor
owl:Class.rdfs:label: flower

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A shoot axis (PO:0025029) that is the primary axis of a plant.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: stalk trunk cane caudices primocane scape caudex bole primary stem tallo tronco culm; eje primario primary axis
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Often bears leaves and buds. It is usually above ground, more or less negatively geotropic, and exogenous in origin.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: stem

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A collective plant organ structure (PO:0025007) that produces root apical meristems (PO:0020147) and the plant structures that arise from them.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: root

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A phyllome (PO:0006001) that is not associated with a reproductive structure.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: hoja leaf sample leaves leaf tissue leaf material fresh-leaf tissue fresh leaf tissue dried leaf tissue dried leaf sample dried leaf Leaf blade
owl:Class.rdfs:label: leaf

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Any portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) other than epidermis (PO:0005679) or vascular tissue (PO:0009015).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ground tissue
portion of ground tissue

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A myogenic muscular circulatory organ found in the vertebrate cardiovascular system composed of chambers of cardiac muscle. It is the primary circulatory organ.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: chambered heart vertebrate heart Herz branchial heart Entire heart
owl:Class.rdfs:label: heart

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The brain is the center of the nervous system in all vertebrate, and most invertebrate, animals. Some primitive animals such as jellyfish and starfish have a decentralized nervous system without a brain, while sponges lack any nervous system at all. In vertebrates, the brain is located in the head, protected by the skull and close to the primary sensory apparatus of vision, hearing, balance, taste, and smell[WP].
owl:Class.rdfs:label: brain

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Respiration organ that develops as an oupocketing of the esophagus.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Snakes and limbless lizards typically possess only the right lung as a major respiratory organ; the left lung is greatly reduced, or even absent. Amphisbaenians, however, have the opposite arrangement, with a major left lung, and a reduced or absent right lung [WP]
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lung

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: the organ that functions to filter blood and to store red corpuscles and platelets
owl:Class.rdfs:label: spleen

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: An exocrine gland which secretes bile and functions in metabolism of protein and carbohydrate and fat, synthesizes substances involved in the clotting of the blood, synthesizes vitamin A, detoxifies poisonous substances, stores glycogen, and breaks down worn-out erythrocytes[GO].
owl:Class.rdfs:label: liver

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A paired organ of the urinary tract which has the production of urine as its primary function.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: kidney

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Breaking the cells open, is the first basic step in a DNA extraction. This is commonly achieved by chemical and physical methods-blending, grinding or sonicating the sample.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: cell disruption

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: The biological activity of a biopolymer is closely linked to its native structure which is retained only if critical factors such as temperature, pH, solvent and solute are kept within narrow limits. Any alteration of the native structure causing a loss of biological activity is called denaturation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: denaturation reaction

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Shearing caused by a round glass pestle that is manually driven into a glass tube
owl:Class.rdfs:label: dounce homogenizer

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A homogeneous mixture of ethanol and water.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ethanol solution

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: An experimental protocol is a sequence of tasks and operations executed to perform experimental research. The protocols often include equipment, reagents, critical steps, troubleshooting, tips and all the information that facilitates reusability.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: experimental protocol

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Homogenize is a experimental action. Homogenize is to make uniform or similar.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: make uniform make similar unite integrate fuse merge blend meld coalesce amalgamate synthesize combine join together
owl:Class.rdfs:label: homogenize

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A homogenizer is a equipment of laboratory used for the homogenization of various types of material, such as tissue, plant, food, soil, and many others. Many different models have been developed using various physical technologies for disruption.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: homogenizer

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: freeze-dried ground tissue freeze dried ground tissue
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lyophilized ground tissue

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: freeze-dried leaf freeze dried leaf lyophilized leaf tissue
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lyophilized leaf

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: freeze-dried root freeze dried root lyophilized root tissue
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lyophilized root

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: freeze-dried seed freeze dried seed lyophilized seed tissue
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lyophilized seed

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000112: lyophilized leaf, lyophilized root, lyophilized seed
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: lyophilized tissue is a tissue dried by freezing in a high vacuum
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lyophilized tissue

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000112: DNA extraction procedure, RNA extraction procedure
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Nucleic acid extraction procedure is a subclass of laboratory procedure used to recover the nucleic acid fraction of an input material entity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: nucleic acid extraction procedure

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Nucleic acid extraction protocol is a subclass of laboratory protocol. A nucleic acid extraction protocol is a step by step description of a procedure used to recover the nucleic acid fraction of an input material entity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: nucleic acid extraction protocol

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Polytron homogenizer is a instrument used for pulverizing plant and animal tissue, grain and seed, soil extraction, DNA/RNA extraction.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: polytron homogenizer

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Shearing is caused by a PTFE- coated pestle that is manually or mechanically driven into a conical vessel
owl:Class.rdfs:label: potter-elvehjem homogenizer

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: pulverized leaf pulverized leaf tissue powdered leaf tissue
owl:Class.rdfs:label: powdered leaf

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: pulverized root pulverized root tissue powdered root tissue
owl:Class.rdfs:label: powdered root

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: pulverized seed pulverized seed tissue powdered seed tissue
owl:Class.rdfs:label: powdered seed

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000112: Grind the seed to a powder. Transfer the powdered seed to a container and weigh the specified amount.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: Powdered tissue is a material entity. Powdered tissue is a tissue that has been pulverirized.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: powdered tissue

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A protocol instruction should have sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between domain experts, so that different domain experts will reliably be able to independently reproduce the procedure.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: protocol instruction

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A RNA extraction procedure is a subclass of nucleic acid extraction procedure where the desired output material is RNA
owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNA extraction procedure

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: RNA extraction protocol is a subclass of nucleic acid extraction protocol. RNA extraction protocol, is a step by step description of a procedure in which is recovered a fraction of RNA from a material entity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNA extraction protocol

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: sample mills cover a broad range of sample preparation equipment and supplies. The range includes homogenizers, blenders and mills for the preparation of high-fat, high-moisture, dry, frozen and fibrous samples.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sample mill

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: An aqueous dilution of ethanol containing 75% ethanol by volume.
owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000118: 75% Ethyl Alcohol Ethyl Alcohol, 75% Alcohol, Ethyl 75% 75% (v/v) ethanol 75 per cent alcohol 75% RNase-free ethanol 75% RNase free ethanol 75% EtOH
owl:Class.rdfs:label: 75% ethanol

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: This step is to wash any residual salt away from the pelleted DNA/RNA.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: washing nucleic acids

owl:Class.obo:IAO_0000115: A procedure is a process that attempts to achieve one or more objectives by following an established set of actions.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: procedure

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Definition: An entity [bfo:Entity] that exists in full at any time in which it exists at all, persists through time while maintaining its identity and has no temporal parts.
Examples: a heart, a person, the color of a tomato, the mass of a cloud, a symphony orchestra, the disposition of blood to coagulate, the lawn and atmosphere in front of our building
Synonyms: endurant
owl:Class.rdfs:label: continuant

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Definition: A continuant [snap:Continuant] that is either dependent on one or other independent continuant [snap:IndependentContinuant] bearers or inheres in or is borne by other entities.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: dependent continuant

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Definition: A continuant [snap:Continuant] that is dependent on one or other independent continuant [snap:IndependentContinuant] bearers. For every instance of A requires some instance of (an independent continuant [snap:IndependentContinuant] type) B but which instance of B serves can change from time to time.
Examples: a certain PDF file that exists in different and in several hard drives
owl:Class.rdfs:label: generically dependent continuant

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Definition: A continuant [snap:Continuant] that is a bearer of quality [snap:Quality] and realizable entity [snap:RealizableEntity] entities, in which other entities inhere and which itself cannot inhere in anything.
Examples: an organism, a heart, a leg, a person, a symphony orchestra, a chair, the bottom right portion of a human torso, the lawn and atmosphere in front of our building
Synonyms: substantial entity
owl:Class.rdfs:label: independent continuant

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Definition: An independent continuant [snap:IndependentContinuant] that is spatially extended whose identity is independent of that of other entities and can be maintained through time. Note: Material entity [snap:MaterialEntity] subsumes object [snap:Object], fiat object part [snap:FiatObjectPart], and object aggregate [snap:ObjectAggregate], which assume a three level theory of granularity, which is inadequate for some domains, such as biology.
Examples: collection of random bacteria, a chair, dorsal surface of the body
owl:Class.rdfs:label: material entity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Definition: An entity [bfo:Entity] that has temporal parts and that happens, unfolds or develops through time. Sometimes also called perdurants.

Examples: the life of an organism, a surgical operation as processual context for a nosocomical infection, the spatiotemporal context occupied by a process of cellular meiosis, the most interesting part of Van Gogh's life, the spatiotemporal region occupied by the development of a cancer tumor
Synonyms: perdurant
owl:Class.rdfs:label: occurrent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An experimental action is a process of manipulation in the domain of the experiment in order to achieve a particular sub goal, which is a part of the goal of the experiment. Reference: EXPO
owl:Class.rdfs:label: experiment action
Experiment action

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A mode of combination is a way of combining, an experimental action with a goal of combination
owl:Class.rdfs:label: mode of combination
Mode of combination

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A mode of transformation is an experimental action with a goal of transformation
owl:Class.rdfs:label: mode of transformation
Mode of transformation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: a mode of category transformation is an experimental action with a goal of category transformation
owl:Class.rdfs:label: mode of category transform
mode of category trnsform
mode of transform
Mode of category transform

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: an action is “the process of doing something or being active” Reference: Collins Softback English Dictionary, HarperCollins Publishers, Glasgow, 1993.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: action
Action

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: to add is an experiment action “to join or unite a component to another so as to increase the number, quantity in the container. The end container is the same for all components” Reference: based on THE OXFORD ENGLISH DICTIONARY (1989) OXFORD UNIVERSITY PRESS, 2 ED.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: add
Add

owl:NamedIndividual.terms:description: “Add 0.2 mL chloroform per 1 mL TRIzol and cap tube tightly.”
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: denaturation reaction 1

owl:NamedIndividual.terms:description: “Add 0.5 mL isopropyl alcohol per 1 mL TRIzol”
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: precipitation reaction 1

owl:NamedIndividual.terms:description: “Add 1 mL 75% ethanol per 1 mL TRIzol and vortex for 10 s.”
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: washing nucleic acids 1
